results.title: Living dangerously
results.creator_credit: Alan Segal and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Reports on the explosion of a chemical factory in Seveso, Italy and the effects of the extremely toxic dust, dioxin, that was released into the atmosphere. The substance dioxin is contained in commercial weedkillers freely available in the United Kingdom.

results.title: The Life and death of Steve Biko
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Clarke, Michael Ryan and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Biko was the founder of the black people’s convention in South Africa which was working towards the abolition of apartheid. After his death in September 1977 whilst in legal custody, his widow and movement leaders claimed he was murdered by the police. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.title_for_label: The Life and death of Steve Biko
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Clarke, Michael Ryan and Granada Television International

results.title: Learning to lose
results.creator_credit: David Mills and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Looks at criticism of the English educational system which maintains that its emphasis on theory over practical skills leaves students less employable. Shows some alternative programs which have succeeded.

results.title: The Last refuge
results.creator_credit: Michael Beckham and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines Paraguay under the Stroessner regime emphasising the regime’s corruption, use of torture and repression, and asylum for some of the world’s most wanted men. Exposes a number of personalities including ex-Nazi Adolf Mengele.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: Killer dust: a standard mistake?
results.creator_credit: Alan Segal and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Twenty thousand workers in the asbestos industry in Britain alone risk contracting fatal lung diseases - including lung cancer. This film indicates that the safety level is far too low. One solution to the problem may be to abandon some asbestos products.

Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: Home help (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Stephen Segaller and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Brindle House in Cheshire treats people with acute psychiatric problems in an informal atmosphere, as out-patients. The staff believe that by being more accessible they are able to intervene before patients reach a critical stage. They also believe that the process of recovery is aided if the patient can remain within the community among family and friends.

results.title: The Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
The progress of 5 people in an intensive group socialisation therapy in a London psychiatric hospital. The film is useful for training of psychologists, group therapists and social workers

results.title: The Dumping grounds
results.creator_credit: John Shepherd, Leslie Woodhead and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Looks at the issue of the makeshift Bantu reservations to which the South African Government is transporting whole communities in furtherance of its “separate development” policy. Reveals an appalling catalogue of mismanagement and neglect on the part of those responsible for this mass transportation of people - and on the Bantu side a total crushing despair.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shepherd, Leslie Woodhead and Granada Television International

results.title: Doctors' orders
results.creator_credit: Colin Richards and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
After the publication of a report on prescribing in general practice, the program looks at the reasons for over-prescribing and talks to several general practitioners who feel they are being pressurised by both patients and drug companies into this expensive and potentially dangerous situation.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
After the publication of a report on prescribing in general practice, the program looks at the reasons for over-prescribing and talks to several general practitioners who feel they are being pressurised by both patients and drug companies into this expensive and potentially dangerous situation.

results.title: Do you mind if I smoke?
results.creator_credit: Sue Woodford and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Investigates the dangers of passive smoking, ie the smoke inhaled by a non-smoker from cigarettes left burning in an ashtray or in someone’s hand. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.
